channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2024020109
item.description:
Report X-2024020109

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PAKCAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP, FROM DOOR 11. IN THE DMP, PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN FOUR, 4 LITER, GLASS BOTTLES OF ACETONITRILE, BEING SHIPPED AS A FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZ-MAT PACKAGE, (UN1648, ACETONITRILE, 3, II, ERG127, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 16 L). TWO OF THE GLASS JARS HAD LOOSE CAPS, WHICH ALLOWED A SMALL PORTION OF THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID TO ESCAPE ONTO THE INNER CARDBOPARD PACKING. ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report E-2024020065
item.description:
Report E-2024020065

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 30, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN3260 was torn and released approximately three (3) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EXE) to remediate the impacted site. EXE personnel utilized hand tools to remediate the site. All loose product and the damaged bag were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All freight was re-secured and re-palletized. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.
